notes.text:
This update for Botan fixes the following issues:

- CVE-2015-7827: PKCS #1 v1.5 decoding was not constant time, it could be used to 
mount a Bleichenbacher million-message attack (bsc#968030) 

- CVE-2016-9132: While decoding BER length fields, an integer overflow could occur 
leading to a denial-of-service (bsc#1013209)
notes.title: Description of the patch

notes.title: Terms of use

notes.text: Botan before 1.10.13 and 1.11.x before 1.11.22 make it easier for remote attackers to conduct million-message attacks by measuring time differences, related to decoding of PKCS#1 padding.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: In Botan 1.8.0 through 1.11.33, when decoding BER data an integer overflow could occur, which would cause an incorrect length field to be computed. Some API callers may use the returned (incorrect and attacker controlled) length field in a way which later causes memory corruption or other failure.
notes.title: Vulnerability description
